speaker: WILLIAM SCULLY
line: Are you going to leave this up all year?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yup. All year. Since you always made us take the Christmas tree down the day after Christmas, I'm making up for lost time.

speaker: WILLIAM SCULLY
line: If your idea of a good time is picking up dried pine needles, treat yourself.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: As if he's an authority on having a good time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's okay, Mom, I got that.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Oh, okay.

speaker: WILLIAM SCULLY
line: Okay, Maggie, let's shove off.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Oh, okay. Well, thank you for having us. Dinner was delicious as usual.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Thanks, Mom. Good sailing, Ahab.

speaker: WILLIAM SCULLY
line: Goodnight, Starbuck. How's work? Good?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yup. It's good.

speaker: WILLIAM SCULLY
line: Well...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, drive carefully.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Uh-huh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Goodnight, Daddy.

speaker: RON POPEIL ON TV
line: Here on Incredible Inventions though, you're not going to spend 110 dollars for it. You all know that. You're not even going to spend a hundred dollars. " Approximate One Month Supply Time May Vary Depending On Frequency of Use or Size of Area to be Covered") There's an approximate one-month supply here... And all you'll spend for this entire package is just 39 dollars and 92 cents.

speaker: WOMAN ON TV
line: Mr. Johnson?

speaker: RON POPEIL ON TV
line: Yes?

speaker: WOMAN ON TV
line: I was kind of interested that Allen used a blond and I hadn't seen anyone use a blond.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dad? I thought you guys left. Where's Mom? Hello. Hello?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mom? What's the matter?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: We, um... we lost your dad. He had a... a massive coronary... about an hour ago. He... he's gone.

speaker: GIRL
line: I swear, Christmas Day... my whole family's opening presents and all and I'm just sitting there in my own little world, thinking "I just wish Jim were here."

speaker: BOY
line: Hmmm, I know. Oh man, busted. Yes, sir?

speaker: HENRY
line: Out of the vehicle, please.

speaker: BOY
line: We're sorry, sir. We'll be on our way.

speaker: HENRY
line: I said, out of the vehicle Keep your hands down. Let's see some ID.

speaker: BOY
line: No, not till I see yours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Last time you were that engrossed, it turned out you were reading the Adult Video News.

speaker: MULDER
line: I didn't think you'd be in today. How are you, Dana?

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Dana." I'm fine, thank you. What are you working on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Two days ago, a couple was kidnapped at Jackson University. Elizabeth Hawley and James Summers, both 19. Last year, another couple was kidnapped to the day except that abduction occured at Duke University. One week later, they found both students' bodies dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: They were kept alive, tortured through that period.

speaker: MULDER
line: No arrests were ever made. Police believed it to be a one-time offender but now it appears to be a serial incident. Anyway, if he holds true to form, we have five days to find those kids.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's a grim deadline.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, here's another grim deadline. In one week, Luther Lee Boggs will take a seat in the North Carolina gas chamber.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How is he related?

speaker: MULDER
line: He claims to have information relating to the kidnapping. He described Hawley's bracelet down to the last detail. This is information that only family members could have known.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or the kidnapper.

speaker: MULDER
line: Boggs feels that if his talents help save these kids then his sentence should be reduced to life in prison.

speaker: SCULLY
line: His talents?

speaker: MULDER
line: He claims to have obtained this information through psychic transmission.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, do I detect a hint of skepticism?

speaker: MULDER
line: Perhaps. Boggs has been there before... in the chamber. My profile helped send him there. He was actually strapped to the chair before recieving an executive stay. He claims that this experience activated in him the ability to channel spirits and demons. I believe in psychic ability, without a doubt, but not in this case. Not Boggs.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So you believe that Boggs is orchestrating the kidnapping from the inside. A scam to save his life?

speaker: MULDER
line: At the age of six, Luther Boggs slaughtered every pet animal in his housing project. When he was thirty, he strangled five family members over Thanksgiving dinner and then sat down to watch the fourth quarter of the Detroit - Green Bay game. Some killers are projects of society. Some act out past abuses. Boggs kills because he likes it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And they've requested you speak with him?

speaker: MULDER
line: Actually, he's requested to speak to me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why you?

speaker: MULDER
line: He read my profile on him and he believes I'm the only one who truly understands what he is. Anyway, I leave for Raleigh this afternoon.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll go with you. The funeral's at noon.

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you should take some time.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I need to work.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry about your father. I'll see you later.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: As a captain, he was entitled to burial at Arlington with full ceremony.

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: This is exactly how he wanted it. Just the family. This song was playing when his ship returned from the Cuban Blockade. He marched right off up to me... and he proposed.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I know that you and Dad were... disappointed that I chose the path I'm on instead of medicine but I need to know... was he at all proud of me?

speaker: MARGARET SCULLY
line: He was your father.

speaker: BOGGS
line: The soul of Luther Boggs drowns in hell's sea of fire. We have him now.

speaker: MULDER
line: We? You mean the souls of your victims?

speaker: BOGGS
line: The dead. The living. All souls are connected.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you're the conduit?

speaker: BOGGS
line: Uh... Dana... Fox... please understand that from here, we can return to the past. We can see the present. We can know the future.

speaker: MULDER
line: From here? Where exactly are you?

speaker: BOGGS
line: Mr. Boggs must be made redemptive for his transgressions.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's exactly what the state of North Carolina intends to do next week.

speaker: BOGGS
line: No. Uh-uh. Let's deal. Boggs' life for the kids, you know what I'm saying?

speaker: MULDER
line: First you've got to prove you're telling the truth. Don't get me wrong, Luther. I want to believe.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Oh... ah... oh, God, no. Must stop. Stop, stop, stop, stop, stop! Pain! I'm in... pain, terrible pain... Uh... the boy, uh, Jim... he's tied with twine. Uh, packing twine. Uh, he, he whip, he whips them with a, a coat hanger, a wire coat hanger. Oh. Dark place. Cold. Cellar. Warehouse, condemned. An angel... of stone. Waterfall. Water falling. It's, it's not a waterfall. Not water. They're there. Oh, God. I got to go. I got to go. I, I got to go.

speaker: MULDER
line: I tore this off my New York Knicks t-shirt. It has nothing to do with the crime.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Somewhere... beyond the sea... Somewhere... waiting for me... Did you get my message, Starbuck?

speaker: GUARD
line: Alright, thanks a lot.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, what's wrong? Did Boggs say something to you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. It's my father. I'm sorry, I'm sorry...

speaker: MULDER
line: It's alright. Why don't you go back to the motel? We've exposed Boggs as a fraud. Boggs is not what he claims to be. He may be orchestrating the kidnapping. Now he knows that we're on to him, he doesn't have a chance with this charade. I'm going to wait around a couple of hours and try to interrogate him. Hopefully, he'll tell me where the kids are.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Somewhere... beyond the shore... we'll kiss just as before... happy we'll be... beyond the sea... And never again...

speaker: BOGGS
line: Water falling. It's, it's not a waterfall. An angel of stone.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's Mulder. I just heard that Liz Hawley's family made a positive ID on the charm you found at the warehouse. The police are searching that place inch-by-inch but they haven't been able to find anything yet. I expected to find you at the crime scene.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Did Boggs confess?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, just five hours of Boggs' channeling. After three hours, I asked him to summon up the soul of Jimi Hendrix and requested "All Along the Watchtower." You know the guy's been dead for twenty years and he still hasn't lost his edge.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I lied to the police about how I found the warehouse. I didn't notice any suspicious activities.

speaker: MULDER
line: Then how did you find it?

speaker: SCULLY
line: It was where Boggs said it would be.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, I told you about Boggs...

speaker: SCULLY
line: I didn't go looking for it! I came across an area that had landmarks he spoke of...

speaker: MULDER
line: That doesn't matter! That's exactly what Boggs wanted! He could have been setting you up! You could be dead right now! Why did you lie in your police report?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought it would be a better explanation under the circumstances.

speaker: MULDER
line: What you're really saying is that you didn't want to go on record admitting that you believed in Boggs! The bureau would expect something like that from "Spooky" Mulder, but not Dana Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I thought that you'd be pleased that I opened myself to extreme possibilities.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why now? After all we've seen, why Boggs? Does this have to do with your father? You said that he didn't approve of you becoming an FBI agent. Now, if being on the job now makes you feel guilty or uncomfortable or uneasy, I think you should back away because if it's clouding your judgement, you're putting yourself in danger.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I love this job.

speaker: MULDER
line: You love your father. Dana... open yourself up to extreme possibilities only when they're the truth. That goes for Luther Boggs... and your father. As for Luther Boggs, he's the greatest of lies. I know he's working with someone on the outside and they planted that evidence. Now, we have to be very careful about planning our next move because he's five steps ahead. The one advantage we have is time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, look at this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Incredible! They found them?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's exactly what I want Boggs to think.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't understand, why didn't the police notify us?

speaker: MULDER
line: They haven't been found, the article is bogus. The Carolinian made this one up just for us, only six people know about it. Later on today, Boggs gets his weekly phone priviliges. Hopefully, he'll call his accomplice to find out what happened. Phone privilige is in two hours.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Go.

speaker: MULDER
line: Turn off that phone. Turn it off.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, it's you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: BOGGS
line: How come you don't believe me? Agent Scully believes me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Agent Scully believes what we all believe. That you have the kids. Now where are they?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder... even if he is setting us up, we have to follow because in three days...

speaker: MULDER
line: Liz Hawley and Jim Summers will be dead.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And then a day later, our only connection to the case will be pulling up a chair at the gas chamber. We have to deal.

speaker: BOGGS
line: The kidnapper is aroused by the prospect of becoming a killer.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's the name?

speaker: BOGGS
line: Can't see... male...

speaker: MULDER
line: Describe him.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Small... thin... late twenties... skull... Human skull... Silver gray... his eyes, cold, very cold... Staring at Elizabeth... God, he's got the wire... No... please, no...

speaker: MULDER
line: Where is he?

speaker: BOGGS
line: He's over... over... by the window... Holding back... holding back his thoughts of killing us... waiting... there's a small boathouse on Lake Jordan.

speaker: MULDER
line: Did you get that?

speaker: BOGGS
line: Mulder... Don't go near the white cross. We see you down... and your blood spills on the white cross.

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: No, no, no, no, no more...

speaker: AGENT
line: Do you see anything?

speaker: 2ND AGENT
line: Negative.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Sweep the docks!

speaker: MULDER
line: Federal agent!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder!

speaker: AGENT
line: Get in there, now!

speaker: SCULLY
line: We need an ambulance... officer down!

speaker: PARAMEDIC
line: What do we got?

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Through and through upper femur...

speaker: NURSE
line: Can't palpate a radial pulse...

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Okay, I want a B.P. on this stat... get him on the gurney.

speaker: PARAMEDIC
line: One, two, three...

speaker: NURSE
line: Blood pressure is 67 on palpatation.

speaker: DOCTOR
line: Okay, tighten him and screen him for six, I want two liters of normal saline in him now and give him two units of o-neg after the typing. Let's transfer now.

speaker: ELIZABETH
line: No. No. No.

speaker: MAN
line: Lucas Jackson Henry, 28. Did some time at Angola in Louisiana for sexual assault, narcotics, nothing big, really. His personal history includes being witness to an auto accident in which his high school sweetheart was killed and his mother was decaptiated. The seven year anniversary of that accident is in three days.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's reliving it. That would explain the deadline.

speaker: MAN
line: The most important element we found is that there's substantial suspicion that Luther Lee Boggs' last five murders were commited with a partner. Now, the police up in Durham say they could never prove it in court but they know that partner was Lucas Henry.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You set us up. You're in on this with Lucas Henry. This was a trap for Mulder because he helped put you away. Well, I came here to tell you that if he dies because of what you've done, four days from now, no one will be able to stop me from being the one that will throw the switch and gas you out of this life for good, you son of a bitch!

speaker: BOGGS
line: Dana... You're the one that believed me!

speaker: SCULLY
line: No! No, I do not believe you!

speaker: BOGGS
line: If you don't believe me, maybe you'll believe yourself. There was that one time when I was fourteen and my parents had gone to bed and I snuck downstairs all alone. Got one of my mom's cigarettes and went out onto the porch in the dark. I was so scared. My heart was beating, I mean, they would have killed me if they knew. But I was so excited. Not ‘cause of the cigarette, I mean, it was gross, but because I wasn't supposed to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That could be a moment from any kid's life.

speaker: BOGGS
line: I know what you want. And I know who you want to talk to. Why don't you just go ahead and ask me?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'll believe you... if you let... me talk to him.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Starbuck... No, no, no! Nobody talks to anybody until I get a deal! Don't underestimate my fear of dying and don't downplay my terror of going back to that chair. I know my hell's going to be to go on back to that chair over and over again but in this life, my one and only life, I don't ever want to go back again! Ever! The last time I went to death's door and looked inside... I had never talked to a minister before in my life ever until that day and he said, "He who doth not love remains in death and he who hates his brother is a murderer..." "And no murderer has eternal life abiding in him." My family, who I killed after their last meal, was right there to watch me over mine... And their fear and their horror that I made them feel when I killed them was injected into me... And their collective fear alone was just one taste of hell. And then I felt myself leave my body. I thought they had already killed me... And I saw thousands of souls rushing into my body. It is a cold, dark place, Scully. Mulder's looking in on it right now.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It may be a cold dark place for you but it's not for Mulder and it's not for my father.

speaker: BOGGS
line: I'm sure he'd like to tell you hisself but I'm not going to let him. Nobody speaks until you get me a deal.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't believe you.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Oh well, there's plenty of room in that cold, dark place for liars, Scully. You go ahead and play it like you need to but I know you believe me. But if you need to convince a judge I'm in on it with Lucas, go ahead. ‘Cause either way, whether I'm running the show with Lucas or I'm channeling, no information's coming until I get a deal. Go on, man, I got nothing to lose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Guard!

speaker: BOGGS
line: If I die, that boy goes to that cold, dark place.

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's still no sign of Lucas Henry or Jim Summers. The Raliegh police said...

speaker: MULDER
line: No matter what, don't believe him. Boggs created this whole charade to get back at me for putting him on death row. You'd be the next best thing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, I never thought I'd say this... but what if there's another explanation?

speaker: MULDER
line: Don't... deal with him. He could be trying to claim you as his last victim.

speaker: SCULLY
line: All right, Mr. Boggs... you got your deal.

speaker: BOGGS
line: Thank you, ma'am. Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Alright, where are they?

speaker: BOGGS
line: Uh... I... uh... I see, like, uh... circles. Uh... I don't know, like... barrels. No, no, bigger, like, uh... huge, uh... vats, uh... factory. Uh, condemned. The old, uh, Blue Devil Brewery up by Morrisville. Oh, God, he's getting, uh, he's getting ready. He... he... he's getting ready to, um, uh... he's getting ready to kill, uh, to kill the d... whoo.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Luther, if you really were psychic...

speaker: BOGGS
line: I would have known you lied. That there never was a deal. I know you tried. Scully... Avoid the devil. Don't follow Henry to the devil. Leave that to me.

speaker: AGENT
line: Freeze!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Federal agents, we're armed! Drop your weapon.

speaker: AGENT
line: There he is!

speaker: 2ND AGENT
line: Get an ambulance...

speaker: AGENT
line: Hold it...

speaker: 2ND AGENT
line: It's gonna be alright, kid...

speaker: AGENT
line: Somebody get over here! Go away!

speaker: SCULLY
line: Go!

speaker: AGENT
line: Over here!

speaker: BOGGS
line: You come to say goodbye?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I believe... that if you had orchestrated this kidnapping, Lucas Henry would have... been aware of the danger you warned me about. He never would have crossed that bridge. So you saved... Jim Summer's life. But you saved mine as well.

speaker: BOGGS
line: You come for some unfinished business? You want your father's message? Not now. Be there tonight. Be my witness. And when they got me in that chair and they... open up that shield... you get your message. into Luther's cell and puts down his last meal. Boggs looks to the left and sees his dead family again, in black-and-white. Boggs is wearing shackles as he walks down the same hallway. He sees his family lining the halls again, the same way in black-and-white. They whisper to each other. Boggs stops and turns around in emotional pain, but the security guards turn him back around.)

speaker: PRIEST
line: Our father who art in heaven, hallowed be thy name, thy kingdom come. Thy will be done on earth as it is in heaven...

speaker: MAN
line: Would you like to make a statement?

speaker: PRIEST
line: ...our daily bread and forgive us our trespasses as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation but deliver us from evil for thine is thy kingdom, thy power and thy glory... Forever and ever. Amen.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I was considering Boggs. If he knew that I was your partner, he could have found out everything he knew about me. About my father...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Beyond the Sea" was playing at my parents' wedding. Visions of deceased loved ones are a common psychological phenomena. If he knew that my father had...

speaker: MULDER
line: Dana. After all you've seen, after all the evidence, why can't you believe?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm afraid. I'm afraid to believe.

speaker: MULDER
line: You couldn't face that fear? Even if it meant never knowing what your father wanted to tell you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: But I do know.

speaker: MULDER
line: How?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He was my father.
